review_blob:
White, foamy, long lasting head atop a light golden, cloudy beer. The aroma is very nice, dominated by citrusy, piney, and light floral hops with a pleasant sweet caramel aroma lingering in the background. The flavor is intense much like the aroma with an added spiciness from the alcohol and hops. This is a thick beer, chewy even, to which the hop bitterness and spiciness are presented. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured in a tulip glass from a 22 oz. bomber. White head with small effervescent bubbles, quickly dissipating, atop a straw yellow beer. Aromas are citrus hops and funky, earthy, yeastiness with an after taste of pineapple. Flavors are sweet grain, citrus, and spicy hops. This beer is full bodied with medium low carbonation. Decent beer, very drinkable. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
beer_name: New Belgium Lips of Faith - Brett Beer

review_blob:
12 oz bottle poured into a tulip glass. Orange amber beer  with a white head, lacing the glass. Aroma of sweet Carmel malt, floral hops and minerals, reminiscent of iron. Flavor is a lot like a pale ale but with a malty aftertaste. High carbonation with a medium body. Very drinkable and enjoyable. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 oz bottle (4-pack) poured into a goblet. Head is white, very thin, atop an orange amber beer. Aromas are complex of floral, piney, earthy hops and no perceptible grain or malt.  Flavors are similar to aroma. Beer has a decent carbonation, chewy, sticky mouthfeel. Alcohol is warming, but not hot. Very drinkable. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Beechwood BBQ, Seal Beach, CA. I've never given a beer a perfect score, but I have never tasted anything quite like this beer before. Completely pleasurable through and through. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
beer_name: Stone 07.07.07 Vertical Epic Ale - Red Wine Barrel

review_blob:
Poured from a 12oz can. Massive, rocky, tan-brown foam atop a jet black viscous beer. The head size may be partly due to the struggle to dislodge it from its hard plastic carrier. Aromas are sting chocolate, roasted malt, and caramel. Flavors, much like the aroma. Highly carbonated, but not quite exploding in my mouth. Dark chocolate, bitter-sweet, coffee, not astringent. Warming alcohol, but not hot. The can says, "After Noon", but I can easily drink this brew in the morning hours.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from a bomber into a goblet, a thick foamy head, one finger high, atop an amber beer with excellent clarity. 
Aroma is dominated by piney, citrusy hops with a subtle edge of vanilla and oak. Alcohol begins to drop in the background as the beer warms. Flavor are intensely complex: hoppy - resinous, citrus -and bourbon oak barrel. Full body, nicely carbonated (medium). 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
beer_name: Great Divide Anniversary Wood Aged Double IPA

review_blob:
Pours jet black with a brown head. Complex aroma of dark roasted malt, coffee, low hop intensity, and light alcohol. The flavor is intense coffee, licorice, chocolate, and toasty malts. Very rich, very enjoyable. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aromas are of American hops, citrusy, slightly earthy (Northern Brewer maybe?), with a subtle but pleasant sweet caremel malt tone in the background. White head, rather thin but lacing, on a gold beer; excellent clarity. The hop flavor is present however not as big as some APAs. The finish is clean and, combined with a high carbonation, this beer is very enjoyable and drinkable. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured this beer into a goblet glass. Thick tan head on a jet black, opaque beer. The aroma is of hops, citrus, piney, and somewhat spicy (rye?). The flavor is complex for an IPA. The zing and earthy spice I'm assuming is coming from a healthy proportion of rye and alcohol. Alcohol is high but not hot or solvent-like. Hop favors ride shotgun with rye in the drivers seat. The finish leaves the mouth watering for more. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
beer_name: Firestone Walker Wookey Jack Black Rye IPA

review_blob:
Opaque black with a thin tan head. the aroma is of roasted grain and light floral hops, intensifying as the beer warms. The hop bitterness is not overpowering and roastiness balenced. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

The aroma is of fresh hops with a faint pale malt hidden in the background. 

The haze lead me to assume bottle conditioning, but the lack of yeast at the bottom of the bottle shown otherwise. Given the intensity of hop aroma and flavor, my next assumption is that this beer was dry hopped. 

The flavor is resinous and floral. An exceptional IPA. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured nicely in a tulip glass, cloudy yellow with a white foamy head. The aroma was imedialy of pilsner malt. Grainy, which seems to be mellowing as the beer warms and the Belgian yeast comes forward along with the earthy, slightly souring effect of the brett. The flavor, much like the auroma, is excellent.

The aroma is citrusy and spicy with overtones of light gain. A billowy white head sits atop this cloudy straw yellow beer. The flavors are complex with a slightly sweet flavor, highlighted by citrus and spiciness. The medium-light body of this beer finishes dry with a slight tartness.  I really enjoyed this Belgian style Witbier; its a great summer beer.
beer_name: Renegade Double Bald Spot Double Wit
